nodes.bodyText:
Does it mean that we now deploy on master branch only? What about v* branches?
As I understand we can do something like:
on:
  push:
    # Deploy when push to `master` branch and all `v*` branches 
    branches:
      - master
      - v*

And then we could do something like:
push:
    needs: build-doc
    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
    if: github.event_name == 'push'
    ...

I could be wrong, did research GitHub Actions too much yet but as far as I know the above should work and trigger push on master, v0.5, v0.4, etc.

+name: CI Docs
+
+on:
+  pull_request:
+  push:
+
+env:
+  STRUCTOR_VERSION: v1.7.1
+  BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS: "-Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -DskipTests=true --batch-mode --also-make"
+  VERIFY_MAVEN_OPTS: "-Pcoverage"
+
+jobs:
+  build-all:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+      - uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - run: mvn clean install --projects janusgraph-all ${{ env.BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS }}
+
+  build-doc:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    needs: build-all
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+      - uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - run: mvn clean install -pl janusgraph-doc ${{ env.BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS }}
+      - run: git diff  --exit-code docs/basics/janusgraph-cfg.md
+      - run: docker build -t doc-site:mkdocs -f docs/docs.Dockerfile ./docs
+      - run: docker run --rm -v $PWD:/mkdocs doc-site:mkdocs mkdocs build
+      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
+        if: github.ref != 'ref/head/master'
+        with:
+          name: distribution-builds
+          path: site
+
+  deploy-doc:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    needs: build-doc
+    steps: 
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+        with:
+          fetch-depth: 0
+      - run: mkdir ./bin
+      - run: curl -sfL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/traefik/structor/master/godownloader.sh | bash -s -- -b ./bin ${STRUCTOR_VERSION}
+      # TODO: change --dockerfile-url=".../v0.5/docs.Dockerfile" to --dockerfile-url=".../master/docs/docs.Dockerfile"
+      - run: sudo ./bin/structor -o janusgraph -r janusgraph 
+            --force-edit-url 
+            --rqts-url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/janusgraph/janusgraph/master/requirements.txt" 
+            --dockerfile-url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/janusgraph/janusgraph/v0.5/docs.Dockerfile" 
+            --dockerfile-name="default-docs.Dockerfile" 
+            --menu.js-url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/janusgraph/janusgraph/master/docs/theme/structor-menu.js.gotmpl" 
+            --exp-branch=master --debug
+      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
+        if: github.ref != 'ref/head/master'

nodes.bodyText:
I don't have a strong opinion here but if we run documentation deployment in master branch only, it means that we will not update documentation for older versions if we don't merge that commit in master branch. That said, we usually merge all commits from v* branches into master branch, so, in most cases there will be no problem.
I'm just curious what has changed in GitHub Actions so that it may run in some issue in other branches. Do you know what issue we may have? Do you know why don't we have that issue with TravisCI but we have it with GitHub Actions?

nodes.bodyText:
The issue exists before. We had to go through all old branch and update the docker image and TravisCI.
To explain the issue:
The document will be built and deploy for all branches with on single branch which could lead to deploy the documentation with a old design if we deploy the documentation from old branch. Someone forgot to update the structor version in older branch. We had this already sometime, it can be fixed by triggering master branch again to rebuilt the doc.

nodes.bodyText:
Got it. Thank you for the explanation. I think, we could extend it this file later to trigger master documentation build when we push to v* branches. That said, no need to do it right now. What I think, is that it might be better to trigger this workflow only when we push to the necessary branch. I.e. you can see in this PR that we actually triggered [deploy-doc] and we spent more then 2 minutes on that workflow even so we didn't actually push the changes and we didn't actually deployed any documentation for this PR.
Basically, what I think, is that it's better to not trigger this step at all if it shouldn't be triggered.
I would still suggest to do it like this: #2266 (comment) . The only thing to change is to remove - v* line. In such case, we will save time not downloading Structor and not doing unnecessary job when it should be skipped.

nodes.bodyText:
I think I was just confused about [deploy-doc] step. I thought this step doesn't b build anything and that [build-doc] is fully responsible for building documentation. Should we move those parts which build documentation to [build-doc] and leave [deploy-doc] with logic just to deploy documentation?
If that's problematic or less efficient, I'm fine leaving it as is

I could change the deploy-doc method to:
  deploy-doc:
    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
    if: github.ref == 'ref/head/master'
    needs: build-doc
    steps: 
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
      - run: mkdir ./bin
      - run: curl -sfL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/traefik/structor/master/godownloader.sh | bash -s -- -b ./bin ${STRUCTOR_VERSION}
      # TODO: change --dockerfile-url=".../v0.5/docs.Dockerfile" to --dockerfile-url=".../master/docs/docs.Dockerfile"
      - run: sudo ./bin/structor -o janusgraph -r janusgraph 
            --force-edit-url 
            --rqts-url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/janusgraph/janusgraph/master/requirements.txt"

            --dockerfile-name="default-docs.Dockerfile" 
            --menu.js-url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/janusgraph/janusgraph/master/docs/theme/structor-menu.js.gotmpl" 
            --exp-branch=master --debug
      - uses: JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action@3.7.1
        with:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          REPOSITORY_NAME: JanusGraph/docs.janusgraph.org
          BRANCH: master
          FOLDER: site
          SINGLE_COMMIT: true

+name: CI Docs
+
+on:
+  pull_request:
+  push:
+
+env:
+  STRUCTOR_VERSION: v1.7.1
+  BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS: "-Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -DskipTests=true --batch-mode --also-make"
+  VERIFY_MAVEN_OPTS: "-Pcoverage"
+
+jobs:
+  build-all:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+      - uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - run: mvn clean install --projects janusgraph-all ${{ env.BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS }}
+
+  build-doc:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    needs: build-all
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-

+        with:

+      - run: mvn clean install -pl janusgraph-doc ${{ env.BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS }}
+      - run: git diff  --exit-code docs/basics/janusgraph-cfg.md
+      - run: docker build -t doc-site:mkdocs -f docs/docs.Dockerfile ./docs
+      - run: docker run --rm -v $PWD:/mkdocs doc-site:mkdocs mkdocs build
+      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
+        if: github.ref != 'ref/head/master'
